Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: The best red velvet cake in Amsterdam. If you are craving some rich American style baked goodies, this is your place. I've been here at least 6 or 7 times and I've never been disappointed. It's usually crowded but I've never waited for a table. Try to sit upstairs where there might be a bit more room

Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: I always love coming here! Somehow I can always find a spot, they serve great vegetarian options and the red velvet cake is to die for. Just one tip: if you plan on eating cake here, just know that one piece of cake on it's own could fill you up for lunch.

Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: Two words: Red velvet. Don't lie and to yourself thinking this is healthy, it's not. But it's an amazing treat that your taste buds will thank you for. Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: Perfect for your sweet tooth craving. Nice selection of cakes, muffins and cupcakes. Generous layer of icing on the red velvet!! Also good for breakfast and lunch. Highly recommended.

Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: Inadequate service. There was nobody at the counter for 10 minutes, then a waiter made a few rude comments while I was waiting for somebody to show up, then they pretended they don't understand that I wanted to buy a whole cake, and, in the end, refused to sell anything, although there was a full fridge of cakes.

Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: Amazing place ! My chicken burger tasted wonderful (just like everything I saw on other tables). The service was perfect : a little lady was alone, overwelmed but here to ask us if we enjoyed our meal. I strongly recommend this restaurant !

Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: If you're visiting Amsterdam and you are a sweet tooth like me, you should definitely visit De Drie Graefjes! They have the best cakes in The Netherlands for a soft price, given the huge piece you get. :)

Name: De Drie Graefjes
Review Text: Lovely place. the cakes were AMAZING, good coffee. Just to say something regular, the waiter was a bit confused or mad.. but the quality of the sweets is amazing!

Name: De Drie Graefjes

Review Text: The homemade quiche was delicious, but the carrot cake had pineapple and raisins in it. Thats not what carrot cake is like back home, but maybe this is the dutch version. Still pretty good cake. Staff really helpfull and nice.
